title: NovoPath Anatomic Pathology LIS Software Announces New Clinical Results Management Module
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/24/2015 @ 5:35 AM   NovoPath, Inc. 
PRINCETON, N.J., Sept. 24, 2015 /PRNewswire/ --NovoPath, Inc. introduces its Clinical Results Management module add-on to its NovoPath(TM) Anatomic Pathology (AP) Software to support the growing demand for AP and Clinical results integration. With this module, NovoPath leverages its deep IT expertise and understanding of lab processes and procedures to create a solution to optimally manage and integrate the Anatomic and Clinical Pathology results into one integrated system. In addition, this module supports the seamless data exchange with clinical instruments. 
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20150923/269894 
"With this module, NovoPath provides flexibility to the AP Labs to produce integrated Anatomic Pathology reports containing Clinical Pathology results, a standalone AP Report or just a Clinical Pathology Report," notes Rick Callahan, VP of Sales and Marketing at NovoPath. "In addition, the clinical information can be imported from other software systems or instruments and displayed in tabular form into NovoPath for quick referencing by the pathologists." 
Additionally, the Clinical Pathology Results module enables the lab to correlate AP and CP results using discrete data and, produce customized trend reports for easy review. 
"NovoPath recognizes that in today's healthcare environment, labs are required to do more for less costs while enhancing services and reducing the probability of error," says Callahan. "The Clinical Results Management Module helps labs do just that. We are committed to helping our customers leverage the technology available to them to meet the needs and challenges they face," concludes Callahan. 
To experience the benefits of NovoPath firsthand, please contact sales or visit www.NovoPath.com and request a demonstration. 
About NovoPath, Inc. 
NovoPath, Inc. develops and markets software solutions for the Anatomic Pathology Laboratory market segment that includes local, regional, national, and in-house laboratories as well as community and university teaching hospitals and medical centers. Since the release of its flagship product in 1999, NovoPath, Inc. has focused exclusively on Anatomic Pathology. NovoPath's mission is to provide unique and unparalleled solutions and services to all aspects of the Anatomic Pathology sector in a way that improves workflow, reduces the probability of human error, ensures results accuracy for greater patient safety, protects patient confidentiality, and above all, produces more precise and informative diagnostic outcomes. More information is available at www.NovoPath.com .
